title: How to Make White Sauce in the Microwave

steps.headline: Heat a pat of butter in the heatproof jug/bowl for one minute until melted - 50 g or so will make about a litre of sauce.
Remove from microwave and add enough flour to make a paste like peanut butter consistency.
steps.description: The ratio of butter to flour should be 1 to 1; 50 g flour to 50 g butter.

steps.headline: Return to the microwave and cook in one minute intervals, stirring with the whisk, until the flour/butter mix resembles coarse sand - this is important.
steps.description: At this point, you have created a roux.

steps.headline: Stir in about a quarter of the milk - don't worry about the lumps, just give it a good stir.
Return to the microwave and cook for one minute intervals until you get a thick, probably lumpy paste.
steps.description: Give it a really good whisk at this stage to break up the lumps.

steps.headline: Add a little milk then give it another good whisk, repeat until all of the milk is added.
Return to the microwave and cook in one minute intervals, whisking in between, until the sauce actually boils - it must boil or it will taste floury.
Add a little more milk to make it thinner if necessary.

text: Heat a pat of butter in the heatproof jug/bowl for one minute until melted - 50 g or so will make about a litre of sauce.  Remove from microwave and add enough flour to make a paste like peanut butter consistency. The ratio of butter to flour should be 1 to 1; 50 g flour to 50 g butter. Return to the microwave and cook in one minute intervals, stirring with the whisk, until the flour/butter mix resembles coarse sand - this is important. At this point, you have created a roux. Stir in about a quarter of the milk - don't worry about the lumps, just give it a good stir.  Return to the microwave and cook for one minute intervals until you get a thick, probably lumpy paste. Give it a really good whisk at this stage to break up the lumps. Add a little milk then give it another good whisk, repeat until all of the milk is added.  Return to the microwave and cook in one minute intervals, whisking in between, until the sauce actually boils - it must boil or it will taste floury.  Add a little more milk to make it thinner if necessary.  Finished.
